content.description:
A few trick pulls past the 1st three bolts leads to the arete and easier climbing up it.



Follow the trail up hill and left from Show Us Ya Badge. This is the 1st route encountered.

6 bolts to chain anchors with a fixed locker.

Climb the crack using an array of specific and occasionally unobvious holds and jams. The crux lies in transferring from one crack to another, but it’s not quite over yet..

Approach Baby Bum Wall from climbers right. Near the start of Sting in the Tail 5.10c, locate and follow fixed chains up the slab. The chains deposit you at the base of My Yellow Country Teeth 5.11c. Dreddies is the next route left.
12 Bolts

Climb the crack using an array of specific and occasionally unobvious holds and jams. The crux lies in transferring from one crack to another, but it’s not quite over yet..

Approach Baby Bum Wall from climbers right. Near the start of Sting in the Tail 5.10c, locate and follow fixed chains up the slab. The chains deposit you at the base of My Yellow Country Teeth 5.11c. Dreddies is the next route left.
12 Bolts

Fun movement and probably a better warmup for Dreddies than Talcum Powder 5.11a is. 

This is the route that the chain access deposits you at. Right of My Yellow Country Teeth is a thin finger crack with 2 bolts to start and an anchor visible at its end. 
Bolts

Up slab past 6 bolts to a trickier baby-butt section past the last 3 bolts.



Directly above the climber's coalition sign where the trail meets the cliff.

9 bolts to a chain anchor with a fixed locker.

climbs.name: So You Think You Can Dance

content.description:
Follow the 1st 3 shared bolts with Take it or Leave it and branch left. Aim up and left for the wide crack feature, encounter a crux after that heading right to the arete that forms the left edge of the wide crack. Finish straight up and back or step right across the chasm to finish through the last bolt of Take it or Leave it and use its anchors (they have chains) instead.



The left side of the Take it or Leave it wall which is roughly 15m up and right from Sting in the Tail and the right hand edge of Baby Bum wall. There is a platform built to belay from and the 1st 3 bolts are shared with Take it or Leave it to the right.

10 bolts back to a Metolius rap anchor.

climbs.name: Sting in the Tail
climbs.fa: Bryce Cox, Ryan Tarves & James Madden 2009

content.description:
4 cruxes punctuated by ledges. The starting corner rewards some jamming and wide leg technique. The next headwall some pretty straight forward cranking. The last two passages a bit more delicate on baby bum quartzite.



On the approach to the Baby Bum wall from the right side, a few feet up hill and right from the Baby Bum traverse ledge access chains find 3 bolts leading up the right wall of a right facing corner. Stage here.

12 bolts to anchor with rings.

Straight up past the 1st three bolts shared with So You Think You Can Dance continuing for a few more bolts before trending back left of a rounded arete to the anchors.



Straight above the belay platform on the far left side of the Take It or Leave it wall, staying to the right of the wide crack higher up on the wall.

10 bolts to chain anchors.

8 walls 
 5.6 - 5.12c sport and trad, couple of multi-pitch  
 Some new routes that are not in the guide book 
  
 Pick up Gord McArthurs guide book from High Country Sportswear in Cranbrook
